group_1.narration: "How dare she show her face after what she did?"
"It's Miura-san's fault that Haitani-san died, isn't it?"
"Even Kuroda's condition is because of her.@They say he still hasn't fully recovered..."

group_1.textLeft: Ow...

group_1.textRight: How could you kill her... Shirogane-san was@overwhelmed with worry for you!
All this time, everything she had been doing@was for you...
She worked tirelessly to save you, Rabi Himuro...@Why, how could you...?!
You understand already, don't you?

group_1.textLeft: Yes...@I won't be showing up for club activities anymore.

group_1.textRight: If it's true, I don't even want to see your face...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, it was me, I was the one who drove the@members crazy...
Are you really going to quit? Just when things were@starting to take off...
Don't blame yourself for the bus accident.@It wasn't your fault.

group_1.textRight: But people around me don't see it that way, and@the kids at the agency could end up in danger.
Besides, there's talk about breaking up the duo...

group_1.narration: The chaos with those students in the parking lot, and the bus@tumbling down the mountain road in flames...
Many students and crew members involved in the accident@suffered casualties, and the screams of the dying drove some@students to mental breakdowns in the parking lot.
The harrowing images and headlines of the major@accident in the newspapers corroded our minds,@and the Professor's explanations further nurtured@a growing sense of emptiness within us.
The Professor started by telling us about Magical Girls@and Kyubey, expanding the conversation to our relationship@with the universe.

group_1.textRight: What isn't known does not exist, neither the stone@monument found nor the history...

group_1.textLeft: Naturally, the same applies to us Magical Girls,@destined to vanish without leaving a trace...

group_1.textRight: Even if it feels futile, we are pawns chosen by@Kyubey,
solely meant to generate the energy that sustains@the universe.
Escaping from that role will never be permitted...
If you try to escape, you'll be treated like a cancer@to the universe...

group_1.textLeft: The Professor also mentioned this:
Just as our immune system protects us from@diseases without us ever realizing it,
there might be a similar system in the universe...

group_1.textRight: So we're going to be killed by the universe without@even knowing...?

group_1.textLeft: ...If you think of the universe as a person,@we are like tiny cells.
No, more like the mitochondria within.
If they try to break free from the rules and functions@of maintaining the body, it's only natural
for the body to try to eliminate them.

group_1.textRight: I felt like someone unseen was targeting us.
Perhaps it was the universe's will...

group_1.textLeft: Yes...
There may be countless unseen forces@manipulating things...
I can't see the signals that control my own body.
If you consider it that way, the seemingly@unreasonable events we experienced
could potentially be attributed to the influence of@the universe.

group_1.textRight: I don't fully get it, but it feels strange...
So everyone at school and us are just puppets?
Are even these words of mine being dictated by@the will of the universe...?

group_1.textLeft: It's unfortunate, but we don't know...

group_1.narration: ―Asahi―@However, it is certain that we are being@controlled by an unseen will.
―Rabi―@Even if we try to erase Kyubey,@even if we try to make our existence known,
―Rabi―@there exists an absolute will that can never be touched...
―Alexandra―@When faced with such a thought,@it feels like we're powerless.
―Asahi―@We can't do anything.
―Urara―@So, we can't be saved.
―Asahi―@That's right, there is no salvation for us at all.
―Asahi―@Just like the rabbits I kill and eat,
―Asahi―@we are sustenance for the universe,@which can kill us at any time.
―Rabi―@If there is ever a time where we can be saved, it will be@when the invisible will of the universe decides it.
―Urara―@All we can do is give up on being saved...
―Alexandra―@Yeah, you are right...
―Asahi―@This is resignation...
―Rabi―@However, the Professor also said that,@if it's possible,
―Rabi―@he wants to make a final determination of the@hypothesis's accuracy before conceding to resignation.

group_1.textRight: People are becoming aware of the existence of@Magical Girls.
If you wish to observe the situation, you should@go to Kamihama City.

group_1.textLeft: Kyubey?!

group_1.textRight: You truly are a mystery, aren't you...
What do you mean, "go to Kamihama City"?

group_1.textLeft: Does that mean we can test the Professor's@hypothesis there?

group_1.textRight: I can't guarantee anything.
But it seems like the best place to conduct an@investigation.
There is an initiative in Kamihama City to promote@the existence of Magical Girls.
It seemed like they were operating as a coordinated@movement rather than just a few individuals.

group_1.textLeft: I find it hard to believe that Kyubey would go out@of his way to make this recommendation.
Isn't there some sort of benefit for you in all of this?@Some kind of hidden agenda?

group_1.textRight: There is something I want to confirm by observing@you all.

group_1.textLeft: What should we do?
It would be wise to consult with the Professor@before heading to Kamihama City.

group_1.textRight: From our perspective, Kyubey is also a crucial@component of the universe's machinery.
But I don't think Kyubey will gain that much from it.
Even if we go to Kamihama City, we'll just be passive@observers inspecting the situation.

group_1.textLeft: I understand. I'd like everyone to come with me to@see what's going on.
I'll continue writing this second volume in the@meantime.

group_1.textRight: Got it.

group_1.textLeft: If the same thing happens in Kamihama City,
we must establish a tradition to ensure that@Magical Girls are never born again.
For thousands, even tens of thousands of years,@denying the process of becoming a Magical Girl.
A tradition destined to be eternally recorded in@the annals of folklore...
And we must also save the Magical Girls who are@here now.

group_1.textRight: Additionally, as you mentioned before, through the@demise of Magical Girls...

group_1.textLeft: ...That's correct.

group_1.textRight: Our disappearance is a significant decision that@will rescue both the present and the future.

group_1.textLeft: That pocketwatch...

group_1.textRight: It's broken, but it's a small gift nonetheless...
Five minutes until midnight...
Please believe that I have truly given up when I set@this clock to midnight.

group_1.textLeft: At the stroke of midnight, a new tradition shall be@etched into folklore...

group_1.textRight: ...The Folklore of Zero.
